name: PQ Tree

complexity.construction: O(n + sum|S_i|) in theory, O(nm) in practice for m constraints
complexity.per_operation: amortized linear in the size of the constraint set

scenarios: Finding a permutation such that each given subset forms a contiguous segment
Interval representation and consecutive ones problem
references: Booth, K.S., Lueker, G.S. (1976). Testing for the consecutive ones property, interval graphs, and graph planarity using PQ-tree algorithms.
